Detailed Description

Fortran 77 interface to error handler for the USGS central CA velocity model (USER INTERFACE).

These routines can be used to turn logging of errors on or off, set the name of the log file, get information about errors, and reset the status of the error handler. See cvmerror.h for the C bindings of these routines. If you are using C++, you should use the ErrorHandler object directly.

The log file will generally contain coordinates of points for which data was not found in the velocity model along with a short string indicating the type of error.

The default behavior is no log file is written (the log file is set to /dev/null). To turn logging on, simply set the name of the log file.

const char *  filename,
int *  err,
const int  len 
)

Set the filename for logging and enable logging.

Calls logFilename().

Parameters:
handleAddrHandle to error handler
filenameName of file
errset to 0 on success, 1 on error
lenLength of filename string (IMPLICIT ARG)
void cencalvm_error_loggingon_f ( size_t *  handleAddr,
int *  turnOn,
int *  err 
)

Turn logging on or off.

Precondition:
The log filename must have been set for logging to work if it is turned on.
Note:
Turning logging on after it has been turned off will cause subsequent messages to be appended to the log file.
Parameters:
handleAddrHandle to error handler
turnOn=1 to turn on logging, =0 to turn logging off
errset to 0 on success, 1 on error
